outboundReferences.contextLine: To break this down intuitively: the summation occurs over every possible coalition (i.e. combinations of players) excluding a single player (the set difference $N \backslash \{i\}$, see [[set-theory]]). The last term in the equation equates to the difference in value with [$v(S \cup \{i\})$] and without [$v(S)$] player $i$.[^1] The Shapley value given by the *average* contribution of a player computed this way.
4. Additivty—Shapley values are additive, such that they can be used in [[ensembles]].
